history.content:
There's no reason to be taking data 100 at this point in your career. Save it for if you can't declare. If you insist on a third technical, I would recommend 16A or B, since you should be taking them ASAP.

I personally did 16B, 61B, and 70 and it was quite a bit of work, although manageable. However, if declaring is a concern, just go with 61B and 70, which will be more than enough work.

==========================================

I disagree with parts of the above statement- I think Data 100 is a really cool class, and that's coming from a computer science major. If you're interested, you should take it! Regardless of what your major is. I do agree though that a third technical may not be necessary if you're worried about workload, 61B and 70 are pretty difficult classes, though if you have lots of experience in large Java projects and also data structures and discrete from your previous studies before transferring here, you might be ok with adding a third technical. Definitely recommend Data 100 if you're even remotely interested in data science!

I personally did 16B, 61B, and 70 and it was quite a bit of work, although manageable. However, if declaring is a concern, just go with 61B and 70, which will be more than enough work.

children.subject: If you're on track for  A+ or high A in cs61A, sure. If not, probably not a good idea.

history.content: I'm planning to take CS61B, CS70, Data 100 (without taking Data 8), and 1 AC class for Spring. I'm planning to declare after this semester. Do you guys think it's too much? I'm a transfer student currently taking CS61A. I have experience with Java and some Discrete Math. What is the expected course load in your experience for these 3 major classes? Thanks in advance.
history.subject: Plan for Spring
